author: jgigler
body:
Steps to reproduce
------------------

Issue a malformed request to an API. In this case the Pager Duty Create Event API is utilized.

Expected behavior
-----------------

```powershell
PS C:\Users\Administrator> Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://events.pagerduty.com/generic/2010-04-15/create_event.json -met
hod Post -Body $body -ContentType "application/json"
Invoke-RestMethod : {"status":"invalid event","message":"Event object is invalid","errors":["Service key is the wrong
length (should be 32 characters)","Service key cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters."]}
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://events.pagerduty.com/generic/2010-04-1 ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (System.Net.HttpWebRequest:HttpWebRequest) [Invoke-RestMethod], WebExc
   eption
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeRestMethodCommand
```

Message is successfully captured in $error variable
```powershell
PS C:\Users\Administrator> $error[0].ErrorDetails.Message
{"status":"invalid event","message":"Event object is invalid","errors":["Service key is the wrong length (should be 32 c
haracters)","Service key cannot contain non-alphanumeric characters."]}
```

Actual behavior
---------------
```powershell
Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://events.pagerduty.com/generic/2010-04-15/create_e
vent.json -method Post -Body $body -ContentType "application/json"
Invoke-RestMethod : Response status code does not indicate success: 400 (Bad Request).
At line:1 char:1
+ Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://events.pagerduty.com/generic/2010-04-1 ...
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (Method: POST, R...ication/json
}:HttpRequestMessage) [Invoke-RestMethod], HttpRequestException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeRestMethodCommand
```

Details are even missing from the $error variable
```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.16> $error[0].ErrorDetails.Message
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.16>
``` 

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->
```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0.16> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
BuildVersion                   3.0.0.0
GitCommitId                    v6.0.0-alpha.16
PSVersion                      6.0.0-alpha
PSEdition                      Core
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
CLRVersion
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
```

comments.author: scrthq
comments.body:
That's normal for Powershell _even_ on Windows. Can you try this to see if it catches the actual error? Some of the catch block may need to be reformed (if it even loads the StreamReader object)

```
try
    {
    Invoke-RestMethod -Uri https://events.pagerduty.com/generic/2010-04-15/create_event.json -method Post -Body $body -ContentType "application/json"
    }
catch
    {
    $result = $_.Exception.Response.GetResponseStream()
    $reader = New-Object System.IO.StreamReader($result)
    $reader.BaseStream.Position = 0
    $reader.DiscardBufferedData()
    $reader.ReadToEnd()
    }
```
